intro: Dasylirion sereke, commonly known as the Sereke grassland yucca, is a perennial plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its rosette of thick, sword-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle. The plant produces tall, branched inflorescences bearing small, white to pale blue flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in xeriscapic gardens.
